title: How to Make Pipi Kaula

steps.headline: Prepare the flank steaks by cutting them into 1 1/3 inch (3.4 cm) wide strips.
Create the marinade.
steps.description: Mix the soy sauce, salt, sugar, garlic clove, ginger, and chili pepper in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Marinate the meat in the refrigerator overnight.
Dry the meat.
steps.description:
This can be achieved by two methods:
Use a dry box. Lay the meat strips on the metal racks and place in the hot sun for two days. Bring the dry box inside each night. Use an oven. Lay the meat strips on metal racks (for example cooking racks). Dry the meat for 7 hours at 175ºF or 79ºC.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Store the meat in an airtight container in the refrigerator or serve immediately as pupus.

text:
Prepare the flank steaks by cutting them into 1 1/3 inch (3.4 cm) wide strips.  Create the marinade. Mix the soy sauce, salt, sugar, garlic clove, ginger, and chili pepper in a small bowl. Marinate the meat in the refrigerator overnight.  Dry the meat. This can be achieved by two methods:
Use a dry box. Lay the meat strips on the metal racks and place in the hot sun for two days. Bring the dry box inside each night. Use an oven. Lay the meat strips on metal racks (for example cooking racks). Dry the meat for 7 hours at 175ºF or 79ºC. Serve. Store the meat in an airtight container in the refrigerator or serve immediately as pupus.
